title: Niall Ronan
text:
Niall Ronan (born 14 September 1982) is a retired <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> <a href="Rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, who played for <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a>, <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> and <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> during his career. He played as a <a href="Flanker%20%28rugby%20union%29">flanker</a>.
Early years.
Ronan grew up playing <a href="Gaelic%20football">Gaelic football</a> and represented the <a href="Meath%20county%20football%20team">Meath county team</a> in the <a href="All-Ireland%20Minor%20Football%20Championship">All-Ireland Minor Football Championship</a>. He won the Senior Schools Leinster Championships in 2000 with St. Mary's, Drogheda.
Leinster.
Switching from football to rugby, he played at underage level for <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a> and Ireland, and spent four seasons with Leinster.
Munster.
He moved to Munster in 2007, and made his debut against <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> in September of that year. He was in the Munster team that beat Leinster to win the 2011 Magners League Grand Final.
A knee injury sustained in Munster's <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a> Round 5 clash with <a href="Castres%20Olympique">Castres Olympique</a> ruled Ronan out for the rest of the 2011–12 season. He signed a new two-year contract with Munster in March 2012.
Ronan earned his 100th cap for Munster on 3 May 2013, coming on against <a href="Zebre">Zebre</a> in a <a href="United%20Rugby%20Championship">Pro12</a> fixture. On 30 April 2014, it was announced that Ronan was retiring from rugby due to a knee injury sustained in October 2013.
Ireland.
He made his debut for Ireland against <a href="Canada%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a> on 23 May 2009, starting and finishing the match in a 25–6 win. He earned his second cap a week later against the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">USA</a>. He was called up to the squad for the 2010 Summer Tour as a replacement for <a href="Kevin%20McLaughlin">Kevin McLaughlin</a> and played against the <a href="Barbarians%20F.C.">Barbarians</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> and <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>.
Ronan also played for Ireland against <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> in a <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2011 Rugby World Cup</a> warm-up on 6 August 2011.
